Content-Type: text/plain;
	delsp=yes;
	charset=US-ASCII;
	format=flowed

Yes, there is an (undocumented) feature to handle NASA format records  
like this

AL                J 6/83AL 1.   0.   0.   0.G   200.000  6000.000      
26.98154 1
  2.53385701E+00-4.65859492E-05 2.82798048E-08-8.54362013E-12  
1.02207983E-15    2
  3.89045662E+04 5.37984173E+00 3.11112433E+00-3.59382310E-03  
8.14749313E-06    3
-8.08808966E-09 2.93132463E-12 3.88283390E+04 2.84045724E+00  
3.96535695E+04    4

that are missing the midpoint temperature on the first line.  The min  
and max temperatures must still be present, however.
All you need to do is replace the 'THERMO' line with 'THERMO NO_TMID'.  
The molecular weight on the first line is ignored, and is computed from  
the composition in the usual way.

Dave





On Wednesday, October 1, 2003, at 03:53 AM, galliumnitrid wrote:

> A reinstallation helped, thanks!
> Just a further question: Is there any routine/procedure in CANTERA
> to use a thermodynamics data file in the NASA format (where comments
> and  molecular weights are in the first line instead of the three
> temperatures)? My test with the  ck2cti.exe program resulted in
> several error messages.
> Regards,
> Burak
>
>
>
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@c...> wrote:
>> The file _cantera.pyd should be all you need. It looks to me like
> you
>> have installed Cantera somewhere other than in the site_packages
>> directory that is the default. If so, did you set environment
> variable
>> PYTHONPATH to point to this directory? You might try reinstalling
> in
>> site_packages to see if that helps... otherwise I'm not sure.
> Anyone
>> else have this problem?
>>
>> Dave
>>
>>

Yes, there is an (undocumented) feature to handle NASA format records
like this


<fixed><fontfamily><param>Courier New</param>AL                J
6/83AL 1.   0.   0.   0.G   200.000  6000.000     26.98154 1

 2.53385701E+00-4.65859492E-05 2.82798048E-08-8.54362013E-12
1.02207983E-15    2

 3.89045662E+04 5.37984173E+00 3.11112433E+00-3.59382310E-03
8.14749313E-06    3

-8.08808966E-09 2.93132463E-12 3.88283390E+04 2.84045724E+00
3.96535695E+04    4


</fontfamily></fixed>that are missing the midpoint temperature on the
first line.  The min and max temperatures must still be present,
however. 

All you need to do is replace the 'THERMO' line with 'THERMO NO_TMID'.
The molecular weight on the first line is ignored, and is computed
from the composition in the usual way.


Dave

and  molecular weights are in the first line instead of the three 

temperatures)? My test with the  ck2cti.exe program resulted in 

several error messages.

Regards,

Burak

<excerpt>have installed Cantera somewhere other than in the
site_packages  

directory that is the default. If so, did you set environment 

</excerpt>variable

reinstalling 

</excerpt>in  

<excerpt>site_packages to see if that helps... otherwise I'm not sure. 

</excerpt>Anyone  

<excerpt>else have this problem?


Dave
